Dear [Name],

We hope this email finds you well. We wanted to follow up on your pledge to support the North America Telugu Society (NATS) and remind you of the impact your donation can have on our community.

We are thrilled to announce that the preparations for our 7th annual convention are well underway, and your support is crucial in helping us to reach our goals. Your contribution will help us provide a platform for the Telugu community to come together and celebrate our cultural heritage through various educational, social, spiritual, and cultural activities.

We would like to kindly request that you convert your pledge into a donation so that we can continue to serve the needs of the Telugu community in North America. Your generosity will go a long way in helping us achieve our mission and make a real difference in the lives of our people.

If you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to reach out to us. We are always here to assist you in any way we can.

Thank you again for your support, and we look forward to seeing you at this year's convention.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]
North America Telugu Society

A counter for fund raising is a tool that allows organizations to track and display their progress towards their fundraising goal. It provides a visual representation of the amount of money collected and the amount still needed to reach the goal. A counter can be displayed in various forms, including digital displays on websites, social media platforms, or in-person events.

Using a counter can help organizations build momentum and engage their supporters in the fundraising process. It provides a tangible way for supporters to see the progress made and feel invested in the success of the campaign. Additionally, a counter can help create a sense of urgency and encourage donors to give sooner rather than later to help reach the goal.

In summary, a counter for fund raising is a useful tool for organizations to track and display their progress towards their fundraising goal, engage supporters, build momentum, and ultimately achieve their goals.

Dear [Name],

Greetings from North American Telugu Society! We hope this email finds you well.

We are writing to extend an invitation to you as our chief guest for our 7th annual convention being held at the Raritan Convention Center from May 26-28. As a highly respected leader in the business community and a proud immigrant, your presence and insights would be a great asset to the 8000 attendees expected to attend the three-day mega event.

We believe that your experience as the CEO of PepsiCo, along with your immigrant journey, would inspire and motivate attendees.

Additionally, we would like to honor you with a Lifetime Achievement Award, recognizing your contributions to the business world and your positive impact on the community.

We understand that your time is valuable and would like to thank you for considering this invitation. If you are interested in participating, please let us know and we will be happy to discuss further details with you.

Best regards,
[Your Name]

North American Telugu Society (NATS) is a non-profit organization formed in 2009 by 200 volunteers with the goal of serving the Telugu community across North America. The organization aims to promote Telugu culture, heritage, and values through cultural, spiritual, social, and educational activities. NATS has a 24/7 helpline service and bi-annually conducts a 3-day convention attended by approximately 8000 people. The convention includes cultural, literary, business symposiums, shark tanks, continuing education classes, women's forums, and career development events for the younger generation. NATS invites prominent dignitaries and leaders to attend the event and has honored them with Lifetime Achievement Awards in the past.
letter to invite dignitaries to NATS

Dear [Dignitary Name],

Greetings from the North American Telugu Society! We hope this letter finds you well.

We are writing to invite you to be a part of the 7th bi-annual NATS convention, to be held at the Raritan Convention Center, New Jersey, from May 26th to 28th. The NATS convention is a three-day event that brings together the Telugu community in North America to celebrate our cultural heritage and to connect with one another through various cultural, spiritual, social, and educational activities.

As a leader in your field, we believe that your presence at the convention would be a great source of inspiration and motivation for our attendees. We would like to invite you to address the gathering of 8000 people on the mainstage during primetime and share your experience as an immigrant and CEO of [Company Name]. We would also like to honor you with a Lifetime Achievement Award in recognition of your achievements and contributions to society.

In addition to the mainstage address, we would like to invite you to address an exclusive "CXO" group and share your experience as a successful business leader. Your insights and expertise would be greatly appreciated by the attendees, who are high net worth individuals and Telugu speaking professionals with a disposable income range of $100K to $250K+.

We believe that your participation in this event will provide you with an exceptional opportunity to connect with the Telugu community, establish new business relationships, and showcase your products and services to a highly targeted and engaged audience.

If you are interested in being a part of this event, please let us know and we will be happy to provide you with more information.

Thank you for your time and consideration. We look forward to hearing back from you soon.

Best regards,

[Your Name]

North American Telugu Society
